channel.title: Character Encoding on Everyone Has a Story
channel.description: Recent content in Character Encoding on Everyone Has a Story

item.title: Javascript uses utf16 and Html utf8, then how things work together?
item.description: This was part of one the discussion of dgplug discussion, that javascript uses utf-16 and html we usually use utf-8 as character encoding then how things work out. This was quite intresting on how things work around because of this. So I was reading around to find answers for the above question and I landed upon this. And this text from the answer in the link helps understand how things work.
